artist: Artist: Unknown , Japanese; Inscriber: Inscription attributed to Nankō Sōgen
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: boy at L, holding switch in one hand, tugs on rope attached to ox's nose, at R; ox looking towards boy but does not appear to be moving; standing on embankment
inscription: ULC: 近日官租重民家牛不肥牧童思軟草拽欲別村之(The recent tax is so heavy; that the people and bulls never get fat; the herdboy longs for soft (nourishing) grass; and wants to drag the bull to another village.)
signed: ULC: 漁庵題 {Gyoan dai} (Inscribed by Gyoan)
text:
Inscription (upper left):

The recent tax is so heavy 
that the people and bulls never get fat.
The herdboy longs for soft grass 
and wants to drag the bull to another village.
title: Ox and Herdboy
